meanings.definition: Comparative form of fleet: moving swiftly or quickly
meanings.sent1: The cheetah is the fleeter animal in the savannah.
meanings.sent2: The hare is fleeter than the tortoise in the race.
meanings.sent3: The wind was feeling fleeter than ever, racing through the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were fleeter than lightning, jumping from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed fleeter after the heavy rain, rushing downstream with great speed.

meanings.definition: One who flees or runs away
meanings.sent1: The fleeter escaped into the woods before anyone could catch him.
meanings.sent2: The fleeter was never caught by the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The fleeter in the movie always managed to escape the bad guys in the end.
meanings.sent4: The fleeter in the story vanished into thin air, leaving everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The fleeter left a trail of dust behind as he ran away from the danger.

meanings.definition: A fleet of ships or vehicles
meanings.sent1: The fleeter sailed across the ocean with great speed.
meanings.sent2: The fleeter lined up in formation for battle.
meanings.sent3: The fleeter of cars zoomed down the highway, leaving other drivers in awe.
meanings.sent4: The fleeter of planes took off simultaneously, filling the sky with their presence.
meanings.sent5: The fleeter of ships set sail at dawn, ready to explore the unknown waters ahead.
